comments.commentBody:
So far, I have not heard or read that the Trump campaign devoted even an iota as much attention to ANY other country in the world. why were they giving so much attention to one country during a US presidential campaign and in so doing, so often taking stances that supported the interests of this country. Why was it only important to seek out better relations with Russia only.

And why in all the documented meetings with Russian officials, did not one Trump representative EVER tell them (as President Obama pointedly did with Putin) "Stop meddling in our elections."?

~
~
The Times needs to go to greater efforts to ensure its readers know that Bannon had already enlisted Sessions and his minion Miller to play a part in his vision for the country.

It was only when Trump came along to play the willing dupe that the rest of the pieces of Bannon's plot fell into place.

It is just as much that Session's is a Bannon pawn as it is Trump's blind loyalty requirements that things have declined nowhere the nation finds itself today.

The plot is far more nefarious than most Americans could fathom. When the truth comes to light, most Americans will simply find it unfathomable.

If this were really true, Trump would have done so, and you know it,

I have not taken out an insurance policy to protect me from the possibility that the revelation of Trump's tax returns will prove me a paranoiac who makes false accusations.

Actually, Amy, we don't.

We think it's a scandal that the Attorney General LIED about those meetings.

What part of this don't you get?

Meetings with representatives of foreign governments--fine. Lying under oath about meetings with representatives of foreign governments--perjury and treason.

Brian

You will be singing the same song as they frog march Emperor Donnie out of the White House in handcuffs.
Tovarich Trump must release his tax returns; otherwise, the witch hunt is better described as which one's next to resign.
Trump will soon be written into the TV show "The Americans". Truth is stranger than fiction.
Puts me in mind of Wikileaks and the measured release of damaging info on Clinton.

What is it that we know and what remains to be determined about this Russian conundrum? FACT: The Russians intentionally and surreptitiously interfered with our democratic process of a free and fair election in order to discredit one candidate in favor of another. Unless you are a member of the Flat Earth Society or your last name is "Trump", that is widely accepted as the truth. What we don't know, at this point, is whether or not there was collusion between the Trump campaign and the Russians to undermine the candidacy of Clinton. The question then becomes, based upon the ever-burgeoning disclosures of multiple and high level interactions of Trump staffers, friends, attorney generals, collogues, sons-in-law, aides, surrogates, etc, (you get the picture) with the Russian oligarchy, is it more probable than not, that the Trump Camp made a Faustian deal with the Russians? The logical inference would be "Yes"..., which ultimately delegitimizes the Trump election. Perhaps, we should ask Trump for an electoral "Mulligan". I am sure that he has taken many a Mulligan in his day...

Who has the guts to call Trump and his appointees on the carpet? As someone who had real estate dealing with him years ago, I can tell you that the behavior we are witnessing is both typical and completely unacceptable. Those Americans who voted for Trump thinking that he would create jobs for them will, soon enough, see that it was all just a ploy.
But all politicians and elected officials have only one goal: to get elected or elected. Fine. But when reliable of evidence of hanky panky surfaces and unethical behavior that you would not condone in your grandmother surface, someone needs to stand up and be counted. This is not just another presidency. This is about the future, for our children and (as the Moody Blues prophetically put it) for our childrens' childrens' children. I don't know the laws / rules. Can we just get rid of all these people and start over again - and I'm not talking about Hillary Clinton, I'm talking about someone with some integrity.

Thank you for this.  Will do. Very sobering when put down one by one. When are we empeaching him on grounds of... not paying his taxes, assaulting women, collusion with the ennemy . The choice is vast.... We actually need journalists to keep investigating on the front of assaulted women. There is a pattern and he probably did it to a woment recently and seriously enough to be "prosecutable" Keep up the good work and thank you again for this list. We need to be clear-eyed yet (and that is going to be difficult) not depressed.
Exactly.
Why did Sessions charge his trip to see the campaign for Trump?

You paint the whole spectrum of those that analyze the Russian involvement with what 'only some' suppose. There are many of us who steadfastly believe it wasn't just an attempt to undermine the process, but a real attempt to sway the election to Trump. A successful attempt at that. Russia has done it before and is busy doing the same in Europe right now. And of course there are a whole spectrum of other opinions. By selectively choosing the story that appeals to you the most and ridiculing it, you have attempted to use the false logic known as 'The Straw Man'. long term debaters pick that suspect out of the lineup with no effort whatsoever.

If Trump and his cronies had nothing to hide, they would welcome an investigation by an independent prosecutor - as opposed to the Republican kangaroo courts.

What better way to clear his name and allay suspicions than a truly independent investigation?

Likewise, if Trump had nothing to hide, he would release his tax returns.

That's how a person would act - if they had nothing to hide ...

"Dangerous and distracting?"
I think not.
Democrats have invented their own "red scare." Next, they're going to want to revive the McCarthy hearings.
I am guessing they would. It is just not reported that much as these days Russia is the "big" thing.

Also follow Dmitry Rybolovlev, his control of 9.9% of the Cyprus Bank, Rybolovle's plane activities and Trump's flights to the same locations at the same days, Rybolovlev's purchase of a Florida mansion from Trump for $100 million when Trump was pressed for cash, Wilbur Ross's involvement in the Cyprus Bank as an owner and officer, Deutsche Bank's use of the Cyprus Bank as a correspondent bank, and other connections.

There are too many connections for these to just be "coincidences."
How about administering an emetic and a purgative so that the truth comes out of both ends?
I bet Trump is so glad now he hasn't drained that swamp. Not that he intended to.   It's those swamp rats in the Republican ranks that are trying to save his sorry hide.  If that's even possible.

Could it be Bannon's sly tactic to have all Trump surrogates dissemble, lie, hedge- almost clumsily. This leaves decent journalists on a wild goose chase--over seemongly trivial gotchas. The feeling is daily chaos, indignation, outrage--then fizzle, deadend...deferred investigation...'no biggie...nothing here...move on folks..'
It is a disinformation strategy that befuddles the enemy--like a bad drug. Rational press coverage starts to looks hyper reactive, overly accusing, wildly attacking. The public grows numb.
Travesties fade.
The destruction of the administrative state, the 3rd estate, and a sane state of mind...Mission Accomplished.
Interesting. But we need some drama too in life (not just in Hollywood or Oscar ceremony) and this is what we get through politics.

But the president can put this matter to rest tomorrow. He can demand an independent investigation and release his tax records. We will all see that he's innocent of these swirling suspicions and he can get on with the business of governing.

What do you expect to see in Trump's tax returns, bribes from Putin declared as income?  99% of the people screaming for Trump's tax returns don't understand their own tax returns. It's nothing but grist for the resistance mill.

Rachel Manafort has discussed Paul Manafort's deep ties to Russia and the Russian government, but most importantly has raised the question of how Manafort, with absolutely no experience in running elections and no electoral background at all, wound up as Donald Trump's campaign manager.

Another question she raised regarded the background of our new Secretary of Commerce, who as a senior person at Suisse Bank (I may have the name wrong) was forced out and wound up as the head of the Bank of Cyprus with its deep connections to hiding and laundering money for numerous Russian oligarchs. Why pick a guy with deep connections to billionaire Russians as our new Secretary of Commerce?

Questions abound, and now it's time for some clear answers.
